content: PVC pipe for gravity sewer: Maximum diameter 24 inches. Suitable for sanitary and storm drainage. Not recommended for pressurized water over 100 psi or diameters greater than 12 inches.
PVC pipe classifications: SDR 35 for gravity sewer (non-pressure), SDR 26 for low pressure, SDR 21 for medium pressure (water mains up to 165 psi), SDR 17 for high pressure (up to 200 psi).

Ductile Iron (DI) pipe: Suitable for water mains of any diameter. Excellent for high-pressure applications (up to 350 psi with proper class). Can handle deep burial (15+ feet) without special considerations.

Ductile Iron pipe pressure classes: Class 150, 200, 250, 300, 350. Selection based on working pressure, surge pressure, and burial depth. For water mains under roads with heavy traffic, minimum Class 200.

Reinforced Concrete Pipe (RCP): Primary use for storm drainage 12-144 inches diameter. Requires minimum 3 feet of cover for H-20 loading. Not suitable for sanitary sewer due to corrosion concerns in sulfide environments.
RCP wall thickness classes: Class I, II, III, IV, V based on D-load strength. Class III common for 1.5-3 ft cover, Class IV for 3-8 ft cover, Class V for deep burial (8-15 ft).

HDPE (High-Density Polyethylene) pipe: Suitable for storm and sanitary drainage, 4-60 inches diameter. Excellent for corrosive environments. Can be installed with minimal cover (12 inches) if properly bedded. Flexible pipe requires proper bedding and compaction.
HDPE DR ratings: DR 9 for high pressure water (200 psi), DR 11 for medium pressure (160 psi), DR 17 for low pressure (100 psi), DR 35 for gravity drainage (non-pressure).

Vitrified Clay Pipe (VCP): Traditional material for sanitary sewers 4-36 inches. Excellent chemical resistance. Brittle - requires careful handling and installation. Not suitable for areas with ground movement or high impact loads.

Copper pipe for water service: Type K (heavy wall) for underground, Type L for interior, Type M (thin wall) not recommended for underground. Suitable for small diameter water services (3/4" to 2") only.

Material selection for corrosive soils: Avoid uncoated DI and metallic pipes in soils with resistivity less than 2000 ohm-cm or pH less than 5.5. Use PVC, HDPE, or epoxy-lined DI. Cathodic protection may be required for metallic pipes.

Material compatibility with wastewater: PVC and HDPE suitable for all sanitary applications. Concrete pipe (RCP) susceptible to sulfide attack - use only if H2S levels are low or with protective linings. Cast iron not recommended for sanitary sewer.
